item.title: Data Caps: What They Are and How to Avoid Them
item.description: By: John Shepler If you’re a frequent internet user, you’ve probably encountered data caps. This article explains these usage limits and how to navigate them. OK, What IS a Data Cap? A data cap restricts the amount of data transferred over a connection within a specific timeframe. Usually set monthly, these limits, measured in MB or GB, reset every 30 days. Activities like browsing, file transfers, and cloud backups consume this data.
